subject: Women
lead_paragraph: Donna Lopiano resigned as chief executive of the Women’s Sports Foundation, which she led for 15 years. The foundation, one of the foremost advocacy groups for women in athletics, was founded by the tennis great Billie Jean King in 1974, two years after the passage of Title IX. The foundation will be run by the senior officers Tuti Scott and Marjorie Snyder until a new C.E.O. is named.
